titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, New York State Committee to Reelect the President, Series 12
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, New York State Committee to Reelect the President, Series 12 FA359

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 13:33:32 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, New York State Committee to Reelect the President, Series 12

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This small series contains only a portion of the files of the New York State Committee to Reelect the President [Nixon]. The original extent of the materials was twelve cubic feet. However, shortly after the materials were deposited in the Rockefeller Family Archives, the NYS Committee to Reelect the President (NYS CREEP) was audited by the Internal Revenue Service. The majority of the materials was sent to Washington, DC, and was never returned. The original folder listing of the full collection of 12 boxes is in Box 2, Folder 14. The remaining materials--which comprise this series--were originally found in boxes 9, 10, and 11.

These fragmentary materials document aspects of the 1972 presidential election, the last election prior to more stringent campaign finance laws taking effect. Among these remaining materials are receipts for contributions made to NYS CREEP. There are also cancelled administrative checks indicating the costs associated with running a presidential campaign. However, as noted in the included separation sheet, specific tax documents pertaining to NYS CREEP staff have been removed and destroyed by the Rockefeller Archive Center.

As Governor of New York, Nelson Rockefeller had a prominent role in the 1972 presidential campaign, although President Nixon and he were long-time political rivals. There is no evidence in this material, however, of any direct involvement by Nelson A. Rockefeller in NYS CREEP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stationery, letter of incorporation, list of directors and members of New York State Committee to Reelect the President (CREEP).
